00050 //Define generator - this can be global because its using convert internally
00051 template<typename SRC, typename DST> class TypePtrGenerator: public TypePtrConverterBase
00052 {
00053 public:
00054     void generate( const TypePtrBase &src, boost::scoped_ptr<TypePtrBase>& dst, const scaling_pair &scaling )const {
00055         LOG_IF( dst.get(), Debug, warning ) << "Generating into existing value " << dst->toString( true );
00056         //Create new "stuff" in memory
00057         TypePtr<DST> *newDat = new TypePtr<DST>( ( DST * )malloc( sizeof( DST )*src.len() ), src.len() );
00058         dst.reset( newDat );
00059         convert( src, *dst, scaling );//and convert into that
00060     }
00061 };
00062 void TypePtrConverterBase::convert( const TypePtrBase &src, TypePtrBase &dst, const scaling_pair &scaling ) const
00063 {
00064     LOG( Debug, error ) << "Empty conversion was called as conversion from " << src.typeName() << " to " << dst.typeName() << " this is most likely an error.";
00065 }
00066 
00067 
00069 // general converter version -- does nothing
00071 template<bool NUMERIC, bool SAME, typename SRC, typename DST> class TypePtrConverter : public TypePtrGenerator<SRC, DST>
00072 {
00073 public:
00074     virtual ~TypePtrConverter() {}
00075 };
00076 
00078 // trivial version -- for conversion of the same type
00080 template<bool NUMERIC, typename SRC, typename DST> class TypePtrConverter<NUMERIC, true, SRC, DST> : public TypePtrGenerator<SRC, DST>
00081 {
00082     TypePtrConverter() {
00083         LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00084                 << "Creating trivial copy converter for " << TypePtr<SRC>::staticName();
00085     };
00086 public:
00087     static boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> create() {
00088         TypePtrConverter<NUMERIC, true, SRC, DST> *ret = new TypePtrConverter<NUMERIC, true, SRC, DST>;
00089         return boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase>( ret );
00090     }
00091     void convert( const TypePtrBase &src, TypePtrBase &dst, const scaling_pair &scaling )const {
00092         TypePtr<SRC> &dstVal = dst.cast_to_TypePtr<SRC>();
00093         const SRC *srcPtr = &src.cast_to_TypePtr<SRC>()[0];
00094         LOG_IF( src.len() < dst.len(), Debug, info ) << "The target is longer than the the source (" << dst.len() << ">" << src.len() << "). Will only copy/convert " << src.len() << " elements";
00095         LOG_IF( src.len() > dst.len(), Debug, error ) << "The target is shorter than the the source (" << dst.len() << "<" << src.len() << "). Will only copy/convert " << dst.len() << " elements";
00096         dstVal.copyFromMem( srcPtr, std::min( src.len(), dstVal.len() ) );
00097     }
00098     virtual scaling_pair getScaling( const util::_internal::TypeBase &min, const util::_internal::TypeBase &max, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )const {
00099         //as we're just copying - its 1/0
00100         return std::make_pair(
00101                    util::TypeReference( util::Type<uint8_t>( 1 ) ),
00102                    util::TypeReference( util::Type<uint8_t>( 0 ) )
00103                );
00104     }
00105     virtual ~TypePtrConverter() {}
00106 };
00107 
00108 
00110 // VC90 thinks bool is numeric - so tell him it isn't
00112 template<typename SRC> class TypePtrConverter<true, false, SRC, bool> : public TypePtrGenerator<SRC, bool> {virtual ~TypePtrConverter() {}};
00113 template<typename DST> class TypePtrConverter<true, false, bool, DST> : public TypePtrGenerator<bool, DST> {virtual ~TypePtrConverter() {}};
00114 
00116 // Numeric version -- uses numeric_convert
00118 template<typename SRC, typename DST> class TypePtrConverter<true, false, SRC, DST> : public TypePtrGenerator<SRC, DST>
00119 {
00120     TypePtrConverter() {
00121         LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00122                 << "Creating numeric converter from "
00123                 << TypePtr<SRC>::staticName() << " to " << TypePtr<DST>::staticName();
00124     };
00125 public:
00126     static boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> create() {
00127         TypePtrConverter<true, false, SRC, DST> *ret = new TypePtrConverter<true, false, SRC, DST>;
00128         return boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase>( ret );
00129     }
00130     void convert( const TypePtrBase &src, TypePtrBase &dst, const scaling_pair &scaling )const {
00131         LOG_IF( scaling.first.empty() || scaling.first.empty(), Debug, error ) << "Running conversion with invalid scaling (" << scaling << ") this won't work";
00132         numeric_convert( src.cast_to_TypePtr<SRC>(), dst.cast_to_TypePtr<DST>(), scaling.first->as<double>(), scaling.second->as<double>() );
00133     }
00134     scaling_pair getScaling( const util::_internal::TypeBase &min, const util::_internal::TypeBase &max, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )const {
00135         const std::pair<double, double> scale = getNumericScaling<SRC, DST>( min, max, scaleopt );
00136         return std::make_pair(
00137                    util::TypeReference( util::Type<double>( scale.first ) ),
00138                    util::TypeReference( util::Type<double>( scale.second ) )
00139                );
00140     }
00141     virtual ~TypePtrConverter() {}
00142 };

00146 //OK, thats about the foreplay. Now we get to the dirty stuff.
00148 
00150 template<typename SRC> struct inner_TypePtrConverter {
00151     std::map<int, boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> > &m_subMap;
00152     inner_TypePtrConverter( std::map<int, boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> > &subMap ): m_subMap( subMap ) {}
00153     template<typename DST> void operator()( DST ) { //will be called by the mpl::for_each in outer_TypePtrConverter for any DST out of "types"
00154         //create a converter based on the type traits and the types of SRC and DST
00155         typedef boost::mpl::and_<boost::is_arithmetic<SRC>, boost::is_arithmetic<DST> > is_num;
00156         typedef boost::is_same<SRC, DST> is_same;
00157         boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> conv =
00158             TypePtrConverter<is_num::value, is_same::value, SRC, DST>::create();
00159         //and insert it into the to-conversion-map of SRC
00160         m_subMap.insert( m_subMap.end(), std::make_pair( TypePtr<DST>::staticID, conv ) );
00161     }
00162 };
00163 
00165 struct outer_TypePtrConverter {
00166     std::map< int , std::map<int, boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> > > &m_map;
00167     outer_TypePtrConverter( std::map< int , std::map<int, boost::shared_ptr<const TypePtrConverterBase> > > &map ): m_map( map ) {}
00168     template<typename SRC> void operator()( SRC ) {//will be called by the mpl::for_each in TypePtrConverterMap() for any SRC out of "types"
00169         boost::mpl::for_each<util::_internal::types>( // create a functor for from-SRC-conversion and call its ()-operator for any DST out of "types"
00170             inner_TypePtrConverter<SRC>( m_map[TypePtr<SRC>::staticID] )
00171         );
00172     }
00173 };
00175 
00176 TypePtrConverterMap::TypePtrConverterMap()
00177 {
00178 #ifdef ISIS_USE_LIBOIL
00179     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Initializing liboil";
00180     oil_init();
00181 #endif // ISIS_USE_LIBOIL
00182     boost::mpl::for_each<util::_internal::types>( outer_TypePtrConverter( *this ) );
00183     LOG( Debug, info )
00184             << "conversion map for " << size() << " array-types created";
00185 }
00186 
00187 }
00188 }
00189 }
